intro: Cissus sokodensis, commonly known as the Sokodé Cissus, is a climbing vine native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and tendrils that aid in climbing. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by spherical, red berries that are edible. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Cissus sokodensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
